filter_gauss_1D

PURPOSE

1D Gaussian filter.

SYNOPSIS

function f = filter_gauss_1D( r, sigma, show )

DESCRIPTION 

 1D Gaussian filter.

 Equivalent to (but faster then):
  f = fspecial('Gaussian',[2*r+1,1],sigma);
  f = filter_gauss_nD( 2*r+1, r+1, sigma^2 );

 USAGE
  f = filter_gauss_1D( r, sigma, [show] )

 INPUTS
  r       - filter size=2r+1, if r=[] -> r=ceil(2.25*sigma)
  sigma   - standard deviation of filter
  show    - [0] figure to use for optional display

 OUTPUTS
  f       - 1D Gaussian filter

 EXAMPLE
  f1 = filter_gauss_1D( 10, 2, 1 );
  f2 = filter_gauss_nD( 21, [], 2^2, 2);

 See also FILTER_BINOMIAL_1D, FILTER_GAUSS_ND, FSPECIAL

0028 function f = filter_gauss_1D( r, sigma, show )
0029 
0030 if( nargin<3 || isempty(show) ); show=0; end
0031 if( isempty(r) ); r = ceil(sigma*2.25); end
0032 if( mod(r,1)~=0 ); error( 'r must be an integer'); end
0033 
0034 % compute filter
0035 x = -r:r;
0036 f = exp(-(x.*x)/(2*sigma*sigma))';
0037 f(f<eps*max(f(:))*10) = 0;
0038 sumf = sum(f(:));  if(sumf~=0); f = f/sumf; end
0039 
0040 % display
0041 if(show); filter_visualize_1D( f, show ); end
